reviewText:
Well, I'll get right to it.
This game is the best one of the two games in the series as of right now.
Things it has that L4D2 does not:
+ambiance
+mood
+color scheme
+animations
+hunter mechanics - bhopping the hunter, rooftop access in almost all areas, etc.
+minimal hud elements
All of these go together to make L4D1 a much more 'crisp' feeling environment.

Things about the game I don't like:  (Bear in mind not many of these are the game's fault - and most of these issues fall right on Valve)
- Lack of support from the developers, as it seems mainly, to pun, left for dead" in sake of the sequel by Valve. I mean the game doesn't even have trading cards and early access titles on steam that are purchasable Alpha-stage games DO. What's that say?
- Also
date: no steam workshop.\n- There are a number of exploits in the first game that are left totally unchecked by the default game developers - such as crouch glitching a hunter in versus off of a collision-enabled object such as a moveable car [punchable]. (too many to list here)\n- No competitive mode ever instated in the game: I.E. a rebalancing mode that would work much like the Rotoblin sourcemod plugin - removing tier 2 weaponry or limiting them
recommended: as well as items and health items.\n- No SOURCETV or HLTV equivalent!!!\n- Extremely locked-down engine
hoursPlayed: with SO many commands being set to literally "DEVONLY" tags in the source code itself - making them invisible inside the engine without removing the "DEVONLY" tags or using Sourcemod.\n- No easy or simple way to remove all of the elements of the hud visually [Ilncluding visual recoil] during demo recording
helpfulPercent: for stable recording that feels more 'camera-like'

reviewText:
Story: It's 2009 (I guess), a zombievirus called the Green Flu has broken out. Four immune survivors have to fight off hordes of zombies, and escape. The story seems kind of believable, and is told just how Valve always tells it. 9/10

Gameplay: The gameplay is pretty basic. You choose between 4 survivors, pick-up weapons on the way, and have to make it to a safe room. At the end of a chapter there is a finale. You will have to fight off hordes of zombies, including some special ones, until the escape vehicle arrives. 8/10

Graphics: The game is starting to look dated. It runs on about every PC from the last 5 years, and it will still look scary at times. 9/10

Alternatives: Personally I would get Left 4 Dead 2. It also has the original Left 4 Dead campaign with slightly improved graphics. It costs the same too, but also has workshop support. The only other zombie game I would recommend over this is Half-Life 2 and of course Left 4 Dead 2, both by Valve.

Overall score: 9.1/10. The game is overlooked for a reason, Left 4 Dead 2 greatly overshadows it. You can get this one, but I recommend getting Left 4 Dead 2, it is practically the same, but with more content. It still is a great game, if you want to go back in time and play the original.

reviewText:
At start, some things about Left 4 Dead.
L4D is an awesome game, epic gameplay, graphic, playable characters which are nice, and most important thing - It's a game about zombies !. Yes, i love games with zombies and apocaliptic climate in background. It is a game for everyone who like zombies - Killing like and playing as them. U have 4 playable main characters, which u choose ? It's your decision !. On Versus mode u can play as zombies. U have 5 zombie Bosses" which 4 are playable. 3 are random everyime and 1 - Called Tank - choosed for any player in infected team. All is random.

Then now i choose good and bad atributes of L4D.

Good Sites:
+Great climate.
+Best Multiplayer Mode focused on teamplay.
+Two sites in Multi.
+ZOMBIES !.
+Some effective weapons.
+AI are good.
+Play with friends !.
+Much Campaigns
date:
u can download more if u want.

Bad Sites:
-Not much weapons.
-Some bugs.
-Not open world. U just have to go from 1 point to 2nd point...
-Valve forgot about it some time ago

reviewText:
IMPORTANT!!! This is not a bad game by any means. It is, in fact, a very good game. It's just that Left 4 Dead 2 has everything this game offers AND a whole lot more. If you are looking to get a Left 4 Dead game, just get Left 4 Dead 2. I suppose you could get this game and Left 4 Dead 2 for the sake of bragging rights, but that's really about it. The only reason I have this game in my library is because I preordered Evolve, which, as I said in my Left 4 Dead 2 review, is probably one of the biggest financial mistakes I've made in my life to date.


UPDATE:

Looking at people's reactions to this review, I'm a little unsure whether I should keep this review up to encourage discussion or if I should go ahead and give Left 4 Dead 1 the old thumbs up so people don't get so butthurt.

Also I am a wondering if people were mislead by my biggest financial mistake in my life to date" ramble. Evolve was what I was dissing
date: not Left 4 Dead 1. And I'm not gonna go comdemning people who have purchased Left 4 Dead 1 even if I didn't like it
recommended: because how you spend your money is none of my business.\n\nLook
hoursPlayed: I'm not gonna go lying about how I feel about this game. Yes
voteText: there are enough differences between the two games for them to technically pass as two separate games. The differences just aren't substantial enough for me to justify trying to sell this game as being infinitely better like the entire planet seems to think it is. I will not deny that Left 4 Dead 1 is an absolute masterpiece. I will not deny that there were plenty of changes made from L4D1 to L4D2 that were most certainly NOT for the better (most notably
votesHelpful: the ridiculous camera movement when being damaged). But I am BAFFLED by the fact that people compare these games like they have zero similarities to each other
votesTotal: completely ignoring the fact that both games are built on the EXACT same engine
votesFunny: have the EXACT same base gameplay mechanics
commentsCount: and even use many of the EXACT same in-game assets.\n\nIt's not like I'm never going to play this game. I will absolutely pick this game up on occasion and play for a while. Like I said
column16: I don't think the game is bad at all. I've even gone so far as to make a point (which EVERYONE has made a point of missing) that it is
column18: a fantastic game. But the lack of any truly substantial game-changing tweak from L4D1 to L4D2 on top of the fact that L4D2 has more characters
column24: the appeal of zombie games to me is the killing of the zombies in itself
column25: and L4D2 provides more options in that respect than L4D1. While I absolutely understand that many other people have many other reasons to play zombie games besides the zombie killing in itself (such as atmosphere

reviewText: â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ yeah i have this game my friend gift it to me

Left 4 Dead, I'd say, was definitely a hit classic to bring Valve's infamy up through the charts - it most certainly did revitalize the zombie genre for games, which has been much needed for some time! While not like most general zombie games, it's something casual enough for any sort of video-game fan to pick up! It's very clean (minus the blood and guts) with its UI and very easy to get a handle on, yet its additional features can make it more difficult for any seasoned player! 7/10!

Great fun game to play with friends.  Lasts for hours and hours! Wouldn't recommend playing solo, teamwork makes the dreamwork.  Small gun selection but still a blast with the various scenarios it throws at you.
This game is awesome. I hope valve comes out with l4d3 soon!!

A game which puts you in a fast paced zombie apocalypse, where teamwork is essential and mindless actions often result in tragic consequences. This game is a timeless classic and probably the best example of how a co-op shooter should work.

As a team you are really dependent on your team to progress forward  â€“  this is extremely true in Versus mode in which botched planning or a disorganized team can result in death.

But when it all does go all wrong itâ€™s a hell of a laugh and in the end thatâ€™s what this game is, itâ€™s you trying to survive a zombie apocalypse with your somewhat incompetent friends helping you.  Definitely worth playing and should be on any personâ€™s steam list

After 12 months of release this game had no players at all, ever since Left 4 Dead 2 came out it has hilled over this game by alot, this is what let the game down. There is only about 200 players max on nowadays while every other L4D player is playing the 2nd game.

Although that ruined the game, the gameplay in this game was nice. There were hardly no glitches I came across unless it's the pink water... but other then that the game is pretty good overall and the gamemodes touched it up a bit.

Get this game if you haven't you will enjoy it, but not as much as Left 4 Dead 2 though.

Left 4 Dead is an amazing game. I am a lover of all things Valve, and a sucker for games that make you feel epic in every aspect possible, and this game delievered exactly these things. My interest in buying this game came from the Steam Halloween sales...I knew not much about it except for a pretty cool trailer I saw for it, and was also considering Killing Floor. I got both, and gotta say I love L4D over twice as much. I've never really played a multiplayer co-op before but this just took me by the balls and made them produce a cournucopia of â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ due to the amazing factor. It brings together players easily and in very cool ways. CONSIDERING L4D2 OVER THIS?? Grab this one. The characters are so much more fun imo, and I think the hype of new weapons is unnecessary, as I have never felt a shortage or care of weapon diversity. And melee weapons are cool but more of an extra, and will kill you if you buy a game for that! Also L4D is very populated!!\n\n(My first impressions in comments)

There is absolutely no point in purchasing this product. For the price of 20 dollars, you can purchase left 4 dead 2, which not only includes its original campaigns, but includes all of left 4 dead 1's campaigns, as well as ALL the DLC campaigns. Not only that, but Left 4 Dead 2 also includes the new special infected, that of which also appear in the first Left 4 Dead campaigns that of which are included with Left 4 Dead 2. Left 4 Dead 2 still includes versus modes, and all the original special infected, while also adding a new mutation mode which are scenerio based Left 4 Dead campaigns that are unique depending on the day you play. Left 4 Dead 2 is still able to play custom maps and campaigns as well, so if you somehow get bored of the original Left 4 Dead campaigns, plus the Left 4 Dead 2 campaigns, plus the DLC, there is plenty to offer. However, Left 4 Dead 2 may be better then the first game, but is no technilogical tryumpth over the first, more like an expansion to the first.

For all fans of the zombie apocalypse this is worth more than a try.
It's worth having.
A variety of enemies (some are not really zombies per se but super enhanced mutations like the tank and the hunter)
to fight against and die from.
But at least you're not alone, misery loves company and there are four of you fighting and dying together.
AI controlled buddies do a good job covering your â™¥â™¥â™¥ and healing you.
They are smart most of the time at least, but without them you don't survive for very long.
Life in this game is a struggle or a fight to get from one safehouse to another, in a genuinely
creepy atmosphere.
The graphics in this game really gives a good definition to the word Desolation".
Going thru deserted streets and buildings that remind you of a war torn scenario really adds to
the game's flavor.
The scenes are a work of art.

Weapons and ammo are plentiful in supply so you don't have to go far being defenseless.
This game is a good lesson in teamwork because without it you're dead in this apocalyptic
universe.
This world is not for the rugged individualist.
If you are the loner type then go to Dead Island but if you want to rely on others for your
survival then this is the place.
The world of LFD.

reviewText:
Zombies VS. a Vietnam veteran, a college student, a biker and a white collar black guy.

This game's co-op made it one of the top zombie apocalypse survival games out there.
It isn't Call of Duty or any other first person shooter. One person can't carry the whole team forever. Some of the game's zombies have certain abilities that FORCE the players to work together. If one player runs ahead of the group, there will be a zombie who incapacitates a player and the only escape is by the help of a teammate.
Left 4 Dead is the epitome of undead apocalyptic teamwork. It truly is worthy of all the praise its recieved.

My rating:
9/10.

I love this game.  I've wasted plenty of time over the years on it....  But really, since all of the L4D1 maps (which I think are superior to the L4D2 maps in general) are now included in L4D2, with the ability of the original Survivors to wield melee weapons, my interest in L4D1 has evaporated.  Sad to say that it's so, but I have good memories :)

While L4D2 may have much better mod support, in terms of playing straightforward L4D, no one does it like the original. Still to this day every bit as intense, atmospheric, and fun as it was the day it came out.\n\nBuy the sequel for the mods, buy this one for the game itself.

The game that made me a Steam player.  I have a lot of fond memories with shooters online, but this may be the best.  Until this game, I had never really found a co-op shooter that pulled me in, but I quickly logged in 100+ hours of online play and had a blast.  The achievement system, the stats, the friend community... like I said, this is the game that made me a Steam player, not Half-Life.  I'd also like to think it's the reason why zombie games are a dime a dozen now.  Some of these games were in development before The Walking Dead made it big on TV, because everyone found out how much fun it is to blast zombie in the face with a shotgun in a game with Left 4 Dead!

reviewText: One of my favorite games of all time! One you could play for a long time and not get bored of it. Great characters, gritty setting and an awesome co-op experience. Highly recommended!

This is another game that I have played hundreds if not thousands of hours on, I played them on Xbox so I was glad I got the chance to play some Left 4 Dead again on pc this time. All the stuff you love is there, the co-op the zombies, the survival, the versus, and now that I am playing on pc, there are mods! Sadly something else also remains the same, votekick abuse. It is a real issue I assure you, there are far to many random kicks, but I will say this. Can you imagine how bad things would be without it? Either way its great to see the game again after so many years of playing. One thing I can say for certain is that it was a good port for xbox, its a great pc game, one of the best co-op games and an amazing addition to your library.
Good, classic original feel. Amazing and unique zombie experience unlike no other.
played only on expert mode!

This Zombie Apocalypse is a FPS shooter, which im happy to say has full controller support. You can wield a shotgun, machine gun, handgun or sniper rifle the first two have upgraded versions (the autoshotgun is the best) on top of the guns you get to carry throwables like molotovs and pipe bombs, all to destroy the endless hordes of zombies and anything else you may encounter.
Incase the action gets to thick for you on expert, The game hosts 4 different difficultys. if its to hard just drop it down level, The game tryâ€™s to keep you on the edge of your seat by introducing new enemies (special infected) randomly through the stages, which can be the most annoying thing when playing on harder difficultys, but makes the game alot more fun because they always seem to jump out unexpectedly.
Health is very important, and the game works it in well, each player starts with a medkit which should be used wisely, you can also carry pills (need to be scavenged) which give you a minor health boost temporarily for when your on your ropes, these things come heavily into play the higher you set the difficulty.
Just briefly wanted to touch on the games players A.I = USELESS, its nigh on impossible to do a level on expert when your playing alone.
The replay value is great. and the achievements can have you doing levels over and over, the best part without doubt is the co-op. playing a 4 player game with friends trying to shoot your way through levels on expert is great fun. even when you ruin the session by getting your friends and yourself killed.
If you like FPS that are fast paced and relentless this could be for you. P.S dont startle the witch.
5 out of 5 from me.

Left 4 Dead is a spectacular first person cooperative shooter, and it's largely given rise to the massive coop and party game focused generation we have right now. Before Left 4 Dead the only major coop exclusive games were mods like Sven Co-Op

However, as much as I liked Left 4 Dead it was an imperfect game that was only improved upon gradually through patches and DLC. One of the features that makes Left 4 Dead and it's successor interesting is the AI Director. Valve must have realized Left 4 Dead would be exclusively a rental unless they spiced things up to the player. What the AI Director does is decide where zombies and items in the world are depending on the player's progress and how well they work together. Every time you play the game it is completely different, especially depending on who you play with.

The biggest factor to buying Left 4 Dead is wether or not to purchase the second instead. I believe the campaigns from L4D1 have already been ported to L4D2. As a result Left 4 Dead remains just a curious bit of history and only a purchase if your not a big fan of Valve's big budget changes with L4D2.
Few co-op games are as well balanced and fun as L4D, only the sequel manages to trumph this gem.
11/10, would touch Zoey's butt.

This was an amazing game. Very fluid graphics even on a computer that had been fried several times there was no lagging. Easy mode is almost too eazy but in the end it can throw u for a loop. Of course the more advance the player the higher the difficulty should be set. However regardless of the players skill level the first time through a new map should be set at medium dificulty just to get a feel for the layout. Also the mod selection is limmited but for the most part you wont need any mods. For a more challenging gameplay experience play without sound.

Left 4 Dead is a game that does CO-OP gameplay right. You rely on your team as a whole to surbibe especially on expert mode. For a zombie game it is also top tier no bad third person camera angles like Resident Evil. One of the best FPS's I've ever played without a doubt. If you dont own it pick up the Left 4 Dead bundle that includes the sequel you wont regret it. And if you love VALVE consider picking up the VALVE bundle which includes a ton of games to keep you busy

Originally posted on October 15, 2009

Granted, at first when I heard Left 4 Dead would have only 4 campaigns of 1.5-2 hours length each, I was very confused, however they more I played the demo the more I understood what valve was going for. The re playability of Left 4 Dead is phenomenal.

Gameplay- Left 4 Dead's core gameplay is an incredible amount of fun, and if you've ever played zombie mods for other multilayer shooters and wondered what the most awesome ungodly combination of zombie gaming would be, this is it. Basically you and three teammates (AI or human) go through these campaigns together fighting off hordes of zombies and specialized monsters all while being tormented by the mysterious and much vaunted AI director. Well the director is quite talented at mixing it up. Even on your hundredth playthrough of a given campaign, you won't know where the attacks are coming from exactly. The game does get a bit predictable in terms of spawn points, but that's really only limited by the mapper and the overall feeling is one of scared confusion, perfect for a zombie game. I could describe Left 4 Dead's core zombie gameplay for hours but it's really something you just have to play. It's very intuitive and a whole lot of fun. A few complaints are legitimate, however. In total there are 5 guns besides your side arm(s): shotgun, auto-shotgun, assault rifle, smg, and sniper rifle. A bit more variety and customization would have been nice, though these weapons all work just fine. Also, although you wouldn't know it now, valve has been slow on patching this game up to what it should have been at release, doing things like unlocking all campaigns for versus, and adding survival mode. Ultimately, they will continue to support Left 4 Dead, but they get marked down for being slow.

Graphics- It's a late build of the source engine, but it's still the source engine: nice, but not anything special in 2008, let alone 2009. it does the Job and they have spruced up the lighting and dismemberment effects quite a bit.

Sound- The sound in this game is a lot of fun. The aural cues given off by special infected and the musical crescendos that precede major fights are things you only tune into the more you play. The weapons sound and feel satisfying, and some of the special infected noises are just gross, or even disturbing. Very fun.

Value- Left 4 Dead is a game to be played online, preferably with friends. The bots will give you your money's worth, but the true longevity of this game is in both competitive and cooperative online play. Valves updates both past and possible future ones will continue to add content for the players. All in all, a much better value than meets the eye.

Tilt- I love zombie games and movies, so what might have been an 8.7 on the old scale becomes a 9 on the new one.

For all fans of the zombie apocalypse this is worth more than a try.
It's worth having.
A variety of enemies (some are not really zombies per se but super enhanced mutations like the tank and the hunter)
to fight against and die from.
But at least you're not alone, misery loves company and there are four of you fighting and dying together.
AI controlled buddies do a good job covering your â™¥â™¥â™¥ and healing you.
They are smart most of the time at least, but without them you don't survive for very long.
Life in this game is a struggle or a fight to get from one safehouse to another, in a genuinely
creepy atmosphere.
The graphics in this game really gives a good definition to the word Desolation".
Going thru deserted streets and buildings that remind you of a war torn scenario really adds to
the game's flavor.
The scenes are a work of art.

Weapons and ammo are plentiful in supply so you don't have to go far being defenseless.
This game is a good lesson in teamwork because without it you're dead in this apocalyptic
universe.
This world is not for the rugged individualist.
If you are the loner type then go to Dead Island but if you want to rely on others for your
survival then this is the place.
The world of LFD.

Left 4 Dead, I'd say, was definitely a hit classic to bring Valve's infamy up through the charts - it most certainly did revitalize the zombie genre for games, which has been much needed for some time! While not like most general zombie games, it's something casual enough for any sort of video-game fan to pick up! It's very clean (minus the blood and guts) with its UI and very easy to get a handle on, yet its additional features can make it more difficult for any seasoned player! 7/10!

Play L4D at your peril! This game is completely addictive â€“ at least it is for me. Shooting zombies is just so much fun, especially when itâ€™s made possible by such a well-crafted game. The premise is very simple: you and three fellow survivors have to make your way from one safe house to another until you are finally rescued. Along the way you have to fight off hordes of slavering zombies. In single player mode the AI is pretty good, although your teammates donâ€™t always behave as you might wish them to during the incredibly hectic campaign finales. There are 4 campaigns with 5 maps to each one. Replay value is good due to the fact that the AI changes the zombie attacks and spawn points with each play, so you never know where the horde is going to come flooding from or where the bosses are lurking. When you get bored with the maps supplied there are loads of 3rd party maps and campaigns available on the web. On top of all this you can even play as one the various types of zombies (on a random basis). Personally I find this less satisfying, but it is worth a go just to get the other perspective. This is a simple but truly great game. L4D2 here I come!

A game which puts you in a fast paced zombie apocalypse, where teamwork is essential and mindless actions often result in tragic consequences. This game is a timeless classic and probably the best example of how a co-op shooter should work.

As a team you are really dependent on your team to progress forward  â€“  this is extremely true in Versus mode in which botched planning or a disorganized team can result in death.

But when it all does go all wrong itâ€™s a hell of a laugh and in the end thatâ€™s what this game is, itâ€™s you trying to survive a zombie apocalypse with your somewhat incompetent friends helping you.  Definitely worth playing and should be on any personâ€™s steam list

There is absolutely no point in purchasing this product. For the price of 20 dollars, you can purchase left 4 dead 2, which not only includes its original campaigns, but includes all of left 4 dead 1's campaigns, as well as ALL the DLC campaigns. Not only that, but Left 4 Dead 2 also includes the new special infected, that of which also appear in the first Left 4 Dead campaigns that of which are included with Left 4 Dead 2. Left 4 Dead 2 still includes versus modes, and all the original special infected, while also adding a new mutation mode which are scenerio based Left 4 Dead campaigns that are unique depending on the day you play. Left 4 Dead 2 is still able to play custom maps and campaigns as well, so if you somehow get bored of the original Left 4 Dead campaigns, plus the Left 4 Dead 2 campaigns, plus the DLC, there is plenty to offer. However, Left 4 Dead 2 may be better then the first game, but is no technilogical tryumpth over the first, more like an expansion to the first.

The original, and still the best game of the series Left for dead is still a great play, and while I liked L4D2 typically I always come back to first. The game really is at it's best with four friends working together. Co-op is at the heart of L4D, and it's greatest strength. What valve really nails is the simplicity of the game. There aren't many controls, items, or weapons. You know all you need to know in 5 minutes. But learning, and dealing with certain situations gets better with practice. The verse mode is great, troll your friends with one of the â€œspecial infectedâ€ zombies. Each with it's own special ability. L4D does a great job randomizing enemy spawn points, and mobs seem to trigger right when they should. The atmosphere, and music are on point for this type of game. The graphics can be scaled back, and I find you can run this on practically any PC (not your grandmas Windows 95, but anything from 2012 and up should be fine). The only drawback I find in the PC version is the lack of split screen co-op. This can be done with a command from the dev console, but I think valve should have put it in the menu like they did on Xbox 360. Here is a link if you want to play local split screen.

http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=745113

If you haven't played this one yet and enjoy blasting Zombies with your friends, check it out.

For all fans of the zombie apocalypse this is worth more than a try.
It's worth having.
A variety of enemies (some are not really zombies per se but super enhanced mutations like the tank and the hunter)
to fight against and die from.
But at least you're not alone, misery loves company and there are four of you fighting and dying together.
AI controlled buddies do a good job covering your â™¥â™¥â™¥ and healing you.
They are smart most of the time at least, but without them you don't survive for very long.
Life in this game is a struggle or a fight to get from one safehouse to another, in a genuinely
creepy atmosphere.
The graphics in this game really gives a good definition to the word Desolation".
Going thru deserted streets and buildings that remind you of a war torn scenario really adds to
the game's flavor.
The scenes are a work of art.

Weapons and ammo are plentiful in supply so you don't have to go far being defenseless.
This game is a good lesson in teamwork because without it you're dead in this apocalyptic
universe.
This world is not for the rugged individualist.
If you are the loner type then go to Dead Island but if you want to rely on others for your
survival then this is the place.
The world of LFD.

reviewText: Just bought this pack yesterday after so long. back in the days, my friend and i always went to Cyber Cafe shop to play together. the multiplayer is the best experience ever. i love it.
Left 4 dead is a very great cooperative game to play.\n

Once upon a time I would have listed Left 4 Dead to be in my top 10 favorite games of all time.
Now I'm sad to say that L4D has become a shrivelled husk of it's former glory, any attempts to replay it have ended in quitting out of boredom half way through a campaign, which is a major sour point in a game that was made to be replayable. Any replayability in the game can be attributed to different dialogue and zombies and items that spawn in different places, and that's it. The developers somehow believed that those three factors alone would make L4D stand the test of time and blow people away for generations to come.
The Versus component of the game is not much better than campaign mode, if not worse. I find the teams to be unbalanced and always in favor of the survivors and although this next point isn't exactly related to the game itself, the VS community is rather childish and on the same behavioral terms I'd expect from a daycare for spoiled little brats. While this isn't a development flaw it clearly shows that L4D's competetive scene attracts the wrong kind of crowd and soured an entire half of the game for me.
While it's easy to rag on the negative points, it's also easy to forget what has drawn us to the game to begin with: The atmosphere is perfect (which is more than can be said for it's rushed sequel), the coop serves as an excellent hangout for friends and once in a while you just feel the need to partake in a bloodbath that is clearly scaled to your favor.
It almost pains me to say that L4D has aged as well as milk that has been sitting out for a month. But it's true, L4D just didn't hold out in our hearts and minds.

reviewText: The best co-op from valve

Left 4 Dead is a CO-OP first person shooter game. The game uses Valve's well known Source engine, released in 2008.\n\nThe game is set during the aftermath of an apocalyptic pandemic, you take control of one of four protagonists, which will be known as the Survivors". They will be pitted against hordes of infected zombies in four different game modes
date: a single player mode which the three other characters are controlled by the AI. A co-op campaign mode
recommended: an online versus mode and a four player survival mode.\n\nthe game play focuses mainly on cooperation and working as a team. You will see all the regular features included in other FPS games
hoursPlayed: such as outlined teammates throughout the world
voteText: so you know where they are all the time. A cool feature which I found to be a nice surprise was if a member of your team were to fall off a ledge
helpfulPercent: they won't automatically plunge to their death
votesHelpful: they will manage to hold onto the ledge and the other team members may go and "Help them up" much like you would do if you were healing them.\n\nThe campaign mode has six levels
votesTotal: each containing anywhere between three and five individual chapters in them. Each of the chapters takes place in a set environment which allows the player to explore around to find little Easter eggs
votesFunny: pick ups - such as medi-packs
commentsCount: pain pills
column16: weapons and ammo. These points are supposedly randomly generated so each time you play
column17: they will be scattered around in different spots. There are tons of rooms
column18: tunnels and buildings to explore on every level
column19: and there is no time limit either so you can roam around to your hearts content
column20: provided you don't mind the odd zombie jumping out of the closet to try and eat your brains every now and again.\n\nEach of the Survivors are individually voice acted very well; and you can communicate with your team using quick menus. Some voice commands will sound off automatically such as when you are reloading
column21: you'll let the rest of your team know so they can cover you. This to me was a small addition but added to the realism of the game.\n\nThroughout the game you will encounter a number of different zombies which have their own special attack or mutation
column23: which is a bloated zombie that will spit bile onto the Survivors which attracts other zombies to your location. This again adds a lot of variety to the game so you don't feel as if you are just mowing through hoards of regular zombies all the time.\n\nThe graphics
column24: while are running on an engine which is a number of years old now
column26: and games today sometimes struggle to present them selves as well as Left 4 Dead. Even with settings right the way down on low
column27: it still looks impressive - meaning any rig or potato will be able to run this.\n\nI played the single player campaign on normal mode; while I had no real issues finishing the game
column29: I still was satisfied with the level of challenge which was on offer
column30: I can imagine the hard and advanced levels will be completely mind fumblingly hard though. I tried to play the campaign mode online
column31: but sadly there weren't many games available at the time
column32: but it is something I really want to try just to experience the co-op side of things on this game.\n\nPretty much every one owns Left 4 Dead already
column33: and most will have probably already played it; but I really suggest people that haven't played it or at least purchased it but not tried it to play. You will not be disappointed and this is one of the classics of our generation that you need to experience.\n\nP.S - if anyone would like to have a play through the campaign with me
column34: please add me or hit me up as I would welcome any opportunity to give it ago!"

reviewText: It's fun with lovable characters and zombies that have creative mechanics. I would recommend this game to anyone with a trigger finger.
One of the best coop-shooters ever made. Also the best zombie shooter game.

Left 4 Dead offers the best zombie fighting experience I've had gaming and with great play functionality allowing gamers from all walks of life to start playing without experience. The more casual gamers may sadly get tired of the repetitiveness that zombie killing produces even with several campaigns on offer. Online multiplayer does however offer fun extras to the game as does the variety of zombies included in the storymode. And who doesn't love a great zombie slayer game?

8/10
Pros/Cons

+ A good variety of zombies (provided by the specials") and the multiplayer mode mixes up gameplay.
+ The decent graphics and well integrated audio make for a well-rounded gaming experience.
+ Killing zombies  is a hugely fun novelty compared to most of the modern FPS games of today.
+ Smooth game mechanics with a brilliant pick-up and play style make this an excellent game for all.

- There is no doubt a lack of content given that this game relies on replaying the campaigns.
- Even the different campaigns get slightly repetitive as you play them through for the first time."

reviewText: Really good. peelz here

Watch out for the Incredible Purple Hulk (youâ€™ll see what I mean!)

Play L4D at your peril! This game is completely addictive â€“ at least it is for me. Shooting zombies is just so much fun, especially when itâ€™s made possible by such a well-crafted game. The premise is very simple: you and three fellow survivors have to make your way from one safe house to another until you are finally rescued. Along the way you have to fight off hordes of slavering zombies. In single player mode the AI is pretty good, although your teammates donâ€™t always behave as you might wish them to during the incredibly hectic campaign finales. There are 4 campaigns with 5 maps to each one. Replay value is good due to the fact that the AI changes the zombie attacks and spawn points with each play, so you never know where the horde is going to come flooding from or where the bosses are lurking. When you get bored with the maps supplied there are loads of 3rd party maps and campaigns available on the web. On top of all this you can even play as one the various types of zombies (on a random basis). Personally I find this less satisfying, but it is worth a go just to get the other perspective. This is a simple but truly great game. L4D2 here I come!

5/5

reviewText: gr8 game

Ah, it's a classic. Whatever platform you own this on, fun times are to be had.
You take control of one of four survivors of the Green Flu (Virus?), a nasty disease turning the population into flesh-eating horrors. The rest of the survivors are either A.I., or players (treat the A.I. nicely, and you shall be rewarded). You then proceed to embark on a journey from safehouse to safehoue, 'till the finale, where you must hold out for an amount of time before escape is available. In order to even make it to the finale, or move on at all, tight teamwork is needed. You can share items, heal others, and use z and x to say things such as Help and similar call-outs (after all this time, i still don't know what they're called. Voice commands? I don't know. Someone tell me.) to further help the team.
Now, about the zombies. They are fast. They come in large groups. They are smart. There are certain events which cause them to come in endless hordes, unless something is done that stops them from being attracted. Or the A.I. Director (the thing controlling all the zombies) can send a horde (this one is NOT endless) your way if you spend too much time in one place, or if it feels like it.
There are special infected (each special infected has their own music que, and there can be only around 3 in-game at a time) The Boomer spits bile at you, attratcing zombies. He explodes when shot, showering you in bile. He can also detonate at will, so if he's in your face, shove him away before shooting, or before he explodes.  The Smoker produces a long tounge that drags it's prey to it, where it then claws the living hell out of you. Shoot the tounge, or shoot it before then (it likes to stay far away form the group, so be careful). The Hunter can jump super long distances and great heights, screaming every time. He will pounce on you, clawing you until soemone gets him off, or kills him.   The Tank. The name speaks for itself. This thing is insanely strong, requiring the whole group to put it down. Each punch stuns you and sends you flying. Also, he can throw cars. Fun.    Finally, the Witch.  If you hear any crying women, turn your flashlights off and stay away. Sneak around her. You can shoot her, just expect her to make a beeline for whoever disturbed her, and proceed to down you in one hit. She also has very large health, and does the most damage in the game.
Well, that's all there is. It's a great game to play with friends, or alone. Multiplayer matches, or no. A must-have.
2gud

reviewText: It's The Zombie Apocalypse. Bring Friends.

Much better than the second game.  It has less campaigns, less types of special infected, and less weapons, but that is part of the reason I like to so much more than it's sequel.  It's simplicity.  If I were to try to make a list of all of the reasons why it's better than it's sequel, I would be sitting here typing for an hour or more.
best zombie game ever
If you have 3 friends and an interest of surviving horror action then this game is for you.

Left 4 Dead is a 4-player co-op survival FPS set in a world full of infected that crave your flesh.

You play as either Zoey, Bill, Francis, or Louis (depending on who you choose to play as) and with your friends (online) or
NPCs (if being played offline) along with you on your side, plowing through hordes of the infected whilst trying to reach the safehouse. The final level of each chapter has you escaping in a vehicle of some sort. Each chapter usually contains 4 levels. The game contains 9 chapters.
This is how the main game mode is played.

But besides killing common, there exist other dreaded creatures....

The special infected! Unlike the common infected, these guys have their own unique abilities.

The Smoker, a tall slender infected with a long tongue that's ready to grab you!
The Boomer, a bloated ball of puss, ready to puke on you! Which attracts a horde of infected, so don't get too close!
The Hunter, a hooded covert that pounces and mercilessly claws through your flesh! You'll know when he's near, once you hear his dreaded growl.
The Witch, a sobbing woman that gets enraged when you get to close! Keep your distance, or else she'll shear you into pieces!

And the worst of all.... The Tank!
A giant mass of muscle and speed, ready to smack you to Timbuk2! Killing him usually requires a group effort!


But besides killing infected until you reach the safehouse, other fun modes exist!


Other game modes, such as Infected, has you either play on a team of survivors or special infected, all being controlled by live players, duking it out until one team has been completely wiped out.

Survival mode is a horde mode where you and others fight through countless waves of infected, the goal is to survive as long as you possibly can! This is an online game mode as well, but it's possible to play this one offline.

Even though this game was released 6 1/2 years ago, it holds up extremely well! This is a title that you shouldn't pass up on!

reviewText:
The original, and still the best game of the series Left for dead is still a great play, and while I liked L4D2 typically I always come back to first. The game really is at it's best with four friends working together. Co-op is at the heart of L4D, and it's greatest strength. What valve really nails is the simplicity of the game. There aren't many controls, items, or weapons. You know all you need to know in 5 minutes. But learning, and dealing with certain situations gets better with practice. The verse mode is great, troll your friends with one of the â€œspecial infectedâ€ zombies. Each with it's own special ability. L4D does a great job randomizing enemy spawn points, and mobs seem to trigger right when they should. The atmosphere, and music are on point for this type of game. The graphics can be scaled back, and I find you can run this on practically any PC (not your grandmas Windows 95, but anything from 2012 and up should be fine). The only drawback I find in the PC version is the lack of split screen co-op. This can be done with a command from the dev console, but I think valve should have put it in the menu like they did on Xbox 360. Here is a link if you want to play local split screen.

http://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?t=745113

If you haven't played this one yet and enjoy blasting Zombies with your friends, check it out.

Now there has been an update to L4D2 where you can play with the original characters on the original campagin while adding all the new things that came with L4D2. The melee system, the enhanced graphics, more weapons and more baddies. With this update L4D2 has essentially made L4D obsolete now that everyones favorite characters have moved up to the new game. If you are looking at purchasing this game I would recommend you just buy L4D2 now.

reviewText:
Having played l4d2 for four years, i did not actually play the original Left 4 Dead game but i'm glad i did. This game defintely has a different feel than Left 4 Dead 2.

Here are some notable differences i have noticed playing Left 4 Dead:

- 2 Tanks can spawn in one chapter (This is unlike Left 4 Dead 2 where only 1 Tank is allowed to spawn on non-finale chapters)

- It is much easier to startle a Witch in Left 4 Dead as compared to Witches in Left 4 Dead 2.

- You can friendly fire your teammates with pistols while your incapped (This is absent in Left 4 Dead 2)

- If you fully discharge your shotgun you will perform an additional pumping action before you can shoot again.

- It feels like Hunters attempt to sneak up to you more often as compared to Left 4 Dead 2.

- Ai Bots can shoot car alarms, gas cans, propane tanks and oxygen tanks.


The question many people wonder is if they should get Left 4 Dead since Left 4 Dead 2 has such a large fanbase with the workshop. If your looking to grasp the feel of the original game i would say go for Left 4 Dead, but because of how little people play i would advise buying this game only on sale.

Left 4 Dead 2 is still the better game but defintely did not regret checking out the original feel of the game.

reviewText: POLECAM

amazing, co-op, team based, fps, zombie shooter, hack and slash-ish game.

the game is simply amazing.

10 out of 10.
